description.narrative: The Access to Medicine Index analyses 20 of the world’s largest research-based pharmaceutical companies on how they make medicines, vaccines and diagnostics more accessible in low- and middle-income countries. This activity files includes the 2021 activities.

participating-org.narrative: The Leona M. & Harry B. Helmsley Charitable Trust
UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office

recipient-country.narrative: The Access to Medicine Index will measure pharmaceutical companies' efforts to improve access to medicine across 106 low- and middle-income countries. The Access to Medicine Index team is based in The Netherlands.

title.narrative: Amsterdam Session on Global Health Security Meeting Report
Spotlight on pharmaceutical companies’ actions in women’s health and SRHR

description.narrative: Ahead of a special report in the 2022 Access to Medicine Index, the Foundation has published a Briefing on key issues in women's health and SRHR (sexual and reproductive health and rights), and the role of pharmaceutical companies in making sure essential health products are available and accessible to women in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs).

title.narrative: Workshop on Expanding Access to Generic Medicine – Meeting Report

title.narrative: Writing and publication of the workshop on Expanding Access to Generic Medicine meeting report

description.narrative: On 6 April 2022, the Access to Medicine Foundation convened a virtual workshop to identify solutions for strengthening the global supply of essential medicine and vaccines. The summary of the discussion has been captured in a meeting report, which is now available for download.

title.narrative: On 6 April 2022, the Access to Medicine Foundation convened a virtual workshop to identify solutions for strengthening the global supply of essential medicine and vaccines. The summary of the discussion has been captured in a meeting report, which is now available for download.
Workshop on Expanding Access to Generic Medicine – Meeting Report
Writing and publication for AMR Thematic study: Lack of access to medicine is a major driver of drug resistance. How can pharma take action?

description.narrative: The antibiotic market is unstable, with fragile supply chains and tough market conditions. This report sets out how these factors limit the development of a robust go-to-market model for such products. It features six case studies where companies and their partners are using a combination of access strategies to cut through the complexity and address access at a local level.

title.narrative: Lack of access to medicine is a major driver of drug resistance. How can pharma take action?
